SolrAdapter.name: SolrAdapter
SolrAdapter.description: Ember Data Adapter for Apache Solr.

SolrHandlerType.name: SolrHandlerType
SolrHandlerType.description:
An enumeration of handler types that `ember-cli-solr`
knows how to interact with.

SolrRequestHandler.name: SolrRequestHandler
SolrRequestHandler.description:
An abstract representation of a Solr request
handler, including its type, path and HTTP method.

SolrSearchHandler.name: SolrSearchHandler
SolrSearchHandler.description:
Represents a default configuration of a request
to a Solr search handler.

SolrRealTimeGetHandler.name: SolrRealTimeGetHandler
SolrRealTimeGetHandler.description:
Represents a default configuration of a request
to a Solr Real Time Get handler.

SolrRequest.name: SolrRequest
SolrRequest.description:
Represents an HTTP Request to a Solr server,
including URL path segments, data and options
that control how the request will be executed.

Allows easy setting of data parameters (serialized
as a query string for `GET` requests or a JSON string
for other types).

Construction of this class should either provide
the `data` property or the `options` property,
but not both.

SolrSerializer.name: SolrSerializer
SolrSerializer.description: Ember Data Serializer for Apache Solr.

classitems.description:
The base URL where the Solr instance is hosted.
This property is typically configured by setting
`ENV.solrBaseURL` in your `config/environment.js`
file.
classitems.name: baseURL

classitems.description:
Specifies a default Solr Core to send requests
to. If no default core is configured, this adapter
will not include a core in the request URI path
and the Solr server will use its own default.
classitems.name: defaultCore

classitems.description:
Sets the default serializer for this adapter.
Uses {{#crossLink "SolrSerializer"}}{{/crossLink}} by default.
classitems.name: defaultSerializer

classitems.description:
Sets the data type for jQuery ajax requests.
Either `json` or `jsonp` are supported.
`jsonp` is provided as the default to allow cross-origin
requests to succeed without needing special customization
of the Solr server.
classitems.name: dataType

classitems.description:
Enables or disables sending requests to Solr's
Real Time Get handler. Note that this handler is
disabled by default on many Solr servers.

Real Time Get allows retrieval of documents that
have not yet been committed by retrieving them from
the update log.

If you are using SolrCloud, it is generally safe to
enable this feature.
classitems.name: enableRealTimeGet

classitems.description: Find a record by its unique ID.
classitems.name: find

classitems.description: Find all documents of a type.
classitems.name: findAll

classitems.description: Find multiple documents in a single request.
classitems.name: findMany

classitems.description:
Find one or more records by arbitrary query

The query hash should include the key `q` with
an appropriate Solr query to execute. If this key
is not specified, `*:*` will be used to match all
documents.

The query hash may include the keys `limit` and/or
`offset` to override the Solr request handler's
page size and retrieve rows from a given offset.
classitems.name: findQuery

classitems.description: Builds a request to send to Solr.
classitems.name: buildRequest

params.name: data
params.description: to be sent in the request

classitems.name: buildSolrQuery

classitems.description:
Determines which Solr Core should handle queries for
a given type and oepration. By default,
{{#crossLink "SolrAdapter/defaultCore:property"}}{{/crossLink}}
is used.
classitems.name: coreForType

classitems.description:
Determines the [unique key](https://wiki.apache.org/solr/UniqueKey)
for a given type. Default Solr schemas use the canonical field `id`
and this method defaults to the same field.
classitems.name: uniqueKeyForType

classitems.description:
Determines which Solr Core should handle queries for
a given type and operation.

When
{{#crossLink "SolrAdapter/enableRealTimeGet:property"}}{{/crossLink}}
is set to `true`, this method will choose RealTimeGet
for `find` and `findMany` operations.

Override this method to customize the path and type
of handler that should be used for given operations.
classitems.name: handlerForType
filterQueryForType

classitems.description:
Builds a complete URL and initiates
an AJAX request to Solr.
classitems.name: executeRequest

classitems.description:
Joins two or more strings into a path delimited
by forward slashes without adding redundant slashes.
Any number of arguments can be passed into this method.
classitems.name: combinePath

classitems.description:
Takes a URL, an HTTP method and a hash of data, and makes an
HTTP request.
When the server responds with a payload, Ember Data will call into `extractSingle`
or `extractArray` (depending on whether the original query was for one record or
many records).
By default, `ajax` method has the following behavior:
* It sets the response `dataType` to `"json"`
* If the HTTP method is not `"GET"`, it sets the `Content-Type` to be
  `application/json; charset=utf-8`
* If the HTTP method is not `"GET"`, it stringifies the data passed in. The
  data is the serialized record in the case of a save.
* Registers success and failure handlers.
classitems.name: ajax

params.name: type
params.description: The request type GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.

params.name: type
params.description: The request type GET, POST, PUT, DELETE etc.

classitems.description:
Takes an ajax response, and returns the json payload.
By default this hook just returns the jsonPayload passed to it.
You might want to override it in two cases:
1. Your API might return useful results in the request headers.
If you need to access these, you can override this hook to copy them
from jqXHR to the payload object so they can be processed in you serializer.
2. Your API might return errors as successful responses with status code
200 and an Errors text or object. You can return a DS.InvalidError from
this hook and it will automatically reject the promise and put your record
into the invalid state.
classitems.name: ajaxSuccess
ajaxError

classitems.description:
Represents a requst to `select`, `search` and
other standard request handlers.

This is the handler type that will be used in
`findQuery`, and when real-time get is not enabled
it will also be used in all `find*` operations.

See [SearchHandler](http://wiki.apache.org/solr/SearchHandler).
classitems.name: Search

classitems.description:
Represents a requst to `get` and
other real time get handlers.

This is the handler type that will be used when
{{#crossLink "SolrAdapter/enableRealTimeGet:property"}}{{/crossLink}}
is set to `true` for `find`, and `findMany`.

See [RealTimeGet](http://wiki.apache.org/solr/RealTimeGet).
classitems.name: RealTimeGet

classitems.description: The type of request.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
The path to route the request to. Typical
examples include handler paths like `/search`,
`/select`, `/get`, and `/update`.
classitems.name: path

classitems.description: The HTTP method (verb) to use in the request.
classitems.name: method

classitems.description:
The Solr Core to route the request to.
When not specified, no core will be included
in the path and the request will be routed
to the default core on the server.
classitems.name: core

classitems.description: The handler to route the request to.
classitems.name: handler

classitems.description:
Data to send in the request.
This property is bound to `options.data`.
classitems.name: data

classitems.description:
Options hash that specifies how the request
will be executed.
`options.data` is bound to `data`.
classitems.name: options

classitems.description:
Binds `handler.method` to `method` for convenience.
Represents an HTTP method or verb, e.g. `GET`, `POST`,
etc.
classitems.name: method

classitems.description:
Initialization observer. Checks whether `options`,
or `data` were provided, creates empty hash objects
where they were not, and establishes a binding
between `options.data` and `data`.
classitems.name: _init
